keyConstraints: Must be shot during African dry season (Dec-Mar).
Must be completed by MOONWATCHER's stop date (1966-02-15).
Requires animal wranglers and veterinary supervision.
Requires extensive set builds on soundstages.
Driven by BOWMAN and POOLE's availability.
Requires 145-day exclusive booking for the Centrifuge set and equipment.
Technically complex Zero-G and rotating set photography.
Heavy dependency on experimental slit-scan and front projection VFX.
Requires dedicated motion control rig for 60+ days.
BOWMAN is the key cast member.

castUtilization.MOONWATCHER: 100% utilization during Phase 1, no hold days required.
castUtilization.DR_FLOYD: Scheduled in a single block during Phase 2 to minimize cost.
castUtilization.BOWMAN_POOLE: Long schedule block in Phase 3 optimized for centrifuge scenes first, then other shared scenes.

locationEfficiency.AFRICAN_LOCATIONS: Maximized by completing all scenes in one block during the required dry season.
locationEfficiency.STUDIO_STAGES: Phased set construction and teardown planned to allow for continuous shooting across multiple stages.

equipmentUtilization.CENTRIFUGE: Single, continuous 145-day booking prevents costly re-booking and setup.
equipmentUtilization.VFX_RIGS: Scheduled sequentially (front projection, then motion control) to reduce rental overlap.

laborCosts.overtime: Minimized by adhering to 10-hour day baseline and respecting turnarounds.
laborCosts.penalties: Meal penalties avoided by strict scheduling of 6-hour breaks.
laborCosts.holdDays: Significantly reduced for key cast through block shooting.

efficiencySavings.companyMoves: Estimated $2.5M (in 2025 dollars) saved by eliminating travel between UK and Africa.
efficiencySavings.locationBooking: Grouped booking of African locations provides negotiation leverage.

additionalCosts.centrifugeConstruction: High upfront capital cost for set build and machinery.
additionalCosts.vfxOverages: Budgetary reserve required for experimental VFX processes with high risk of delays.
additionalCosts.contingency: 15% of budget allocated for weather and technical delays.

riskFactors.mitigation: Scheduled in driest part of the season (Jan/Feb). Added 5 buffer days to Phase 1 schedule.
Extended booking for Centrifuge allows for 2 weeks of pre-shoot testing. On-site engineering team contracted for duration of Phase 3.
Schedule VFX phase last to allow maximum development time. Begin small-scale tests during principal photography. Allocate 25% cost contingency for this phase.

recommendations: Initiate immediate booking and permitting for Namibian locations and safari support teams.
Finalize contract with engineering firm for Centrifuge construction and operation by Q1 1966.
Allocate substantial budget for VFX research and development, treating it as a separate, parallel project during early production.
Secure production insurance with specific riders covering technical failure of experimental equipment and weather delays in remote locations.
